entry.title: [GRA5/7/9/SBG5/WAW1/SGP1/BHS5/SYD1][Managed Kubernetes service] End-of-life
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 6, 07:00 UTC  -  Sep 8, 15:00 UTC

Jun 3, 02:35 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 06/09/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 08/09/2022 15:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact expected, except for Apps that do not support the new version
Service improvement: The aim of this maintenance is to migrate all customers to the new version.

entry.title: [GRA][BHS] [Data logs] Index backend migration
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 15, 12:00 - 15:00 UTC

Apr 15, 00:04 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 15/06/2022 12:00 UTC
End time : 15/06/2022 15:00 UTC
Service impact : No downtime expected in term of log ingestion, but ES API will not be available for a maximum time of two hours.
Service improvement: The indexation backend of Logs Data Platform will be replaced from Elasticsearch to OpenSearch.
Kibana instances will be replaced by OpenSearch Dashboards ones.

APIv6 calls related to ElasticSearch backend will be automatically redirected to new OpenSearch backend and will remain available until September 2022.

The following documentation : https://docs.ovh.com/fr/logs-data-platform/ will be updated few days before the migration.

entry.title: [GRA7][Storage] - Volume snapshot
entry.content:
Jun 3, 20:15 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 03/06/2022 16:00 UTC
End time : 03/06/2022 20:13 UTC
Service impact : Slowdowns may have been observed on any action on a OpenStack volume.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. Performance are back to their levels prior the incident.

Jun 3, 17:31 UTC
Identified - Our technical teams are working hard on the issue.
We will update you when the remaining operations are cleaned.

Jun 3, 17:05 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 03/06/2022 16:00 UTC
Service impact : Slowdowns may be observed on any action on a OpenStack volume
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on resolving the issue. We will post update as significant update are made.

entry.title: [Global][Kubernetes] - Openstacks API
entry.content:
Jun 3, 15:34 UTC
Resolved - Everything is observed working as prior the incident.
We are closing the monitoring.

Jun 3, 14:46 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 03/06/2022 11:15 UTC
End time : 03/06/2022 14:43 UTC
Service impact : Kubernetes and LoadBalancing could be found not working
Root cause : Please follow this issue : https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/ntjvy98zs2dh
Our technical teams are resolved the issue. We are monitoring impacted Managed Kubernetes and Load Balancer to ensure operationnability.

Jun 3, 13:04 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 03/06/2022 11:15 UTC
Service impact : Kubernetes and LoadBalancing could be found not working
Root cause : Please follow this issue : https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/ntjvy98zs2dh
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on resolving the issue on the PublicCloud side. It should solve this incident for all impacted services.

entry.title: [Global][Public Cloud] - Openstacks API
entry.content:
Jun 3, 14:41 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 03/06/2022 11:15 UTC
End time : 03/06/2022 14:38 UTC
Service impact : Openstack APIs on GRA7, GRA11 and DE1 regions did not work.
Instances that operate in these two regions continued to work
Our technical teams resolved the issues. APIs' usages has been restored to its state prior the event.

Jun 3, 13:12 UTC
Update - The situation is stabilized for the GRA11 and DE1 regions.
Our teams are keeping these two regions under observation.
We continue to work on the recovery of GRA7

Jun 3, 12:36 UTC
Update - Currently, the areas impacted by this malfunction are the following: GRA7, GRA11 and DE1.
Our teams are still investigating.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused

Jun 3, 12:05 UTC
Update - We are investigating if other Public Cloud regions are impacted.
We'll get back to you soon.

Jun 3, 11:53 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 03/06/2022 11:15 UTC
Service impact : Openstack APIs on GRA7 and DE1 regions do not work.
Instances that operate in these two regions continue to work
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating the origin of this disruption
